PARKING
Free on-site street parking within LoSo Station development Taco Boy will validate 1.5 hours of parking in the garage connected to the MAA apartment building behind Taco Boy, at the corner of Script Ln and Craft St. IMPORTANT: Those seeking validated parking must only use lane 2 and 3 to enter the garage. There is a text-to-park parking lot adjacent to Taco Boy at the corner of South Blvd and Whitton St. 8-hr parking for $3. 
Our Story

Taco Boy LoSo, established in January 2024, is our newest addition located in LoSo Station, Charlotte, NC. It features a large mural by Jen Hill, an in-house tortilleria, in-house DJ booth, bar and dining room seating, as well as a sunroom with retractable doors that open to the patio.

: We offer validated parking up to 90 minutes. Just turn your ticket into the host stand to be validated. Guests should use lanes 2 and 3 to enter the garage.

Attention to our guests with allergies or dietary preferences: We're committed to meeting your needs. Please note, despite our best efforts, cross-contamination can occur. Dishes could come into contact with allergens like dairy, eggs, wheat, soy, tree nuts, peanuts, fish, and shellfish. Crispy and fried offerings are prepared in soybean oil.

Kindly be aware that a 3% processing fee applies to all credit card payments. This fee does not apply to debit card transactions. For ease of transaction with parties of eight or more, a 20% suggested tip will be applied to your check. Thank you for choosing Taco Boy!

Alcohol Consumption Notice: Taco Boy is committed to the safety of our patrons and community. To support this, we provide the availability of transportation after the consumption of alcohol. Please notify your server should you need assistance or a safe ride home and we will gladly make the appropriate arrangements. Alcohol consumption is a personal choice. It is your responsibility to drink responsibly and take appropriate precautions to protect yourself, other patrons, and the community from harm.

We proudly serve alcohol responsibly and appreciate your patience as we ask for ID for all alcoholic beverages.

Catering
We can do it all From corporate lunches to wedding celebrations, bachelor/bachelorette parties, and off-site catering events for large parties. — Make it easy We offer online ordering and delivery through EZ Cater — perfect for office meetings and small parties under 60 people! — Click to Learn More! 
In-House Events
We are Taco Boy — a fun, vibrant, and community-centric taqueria serving up delicious vibes in five eclectic, inviting spaces across the Carolinas. We love to host and welcome all to an exuberant party! Book Your Next Event!

Our Story

Our Summerville location opened in 2019 in the buzzing Nexton community. Our interior is warmly lit with soaring ceilings and authentic Mexican art adorning the walls, while our four-season greenhouse is a go-to spot for soaking up the sunshine in a cheery, green space. We host occasional cornhole tournaments, drag shows, and other festive events that benefit our charitable community partners. Ample parking is available.

Our Story

Taco Boy Biltmore Park is located in the main roundabout of Biltmore Park Town Square. It features a large mural by Wyatt Grant, bar and dining room seating, as well as a sunroom with retractable doors that open to the patio.

Our Story

Open since 2009, Taco Boy Downtown Charleston presents a colorfully rustic den full of authentic Mexican folk art, as well as a spacious outdoor dining and lawn area that’s perfect for parties large and small. Warm nights bring outdoor DJs and dance parties, while festive events occur year-round that support our charitable partners. Well-behaved and leashed dogs are welcome for outdoor dining. Ample parking is available.

Our Story

Our flagship location opened on Folly Beach in 2006. In 2020, we moved into our current location on East Ashley Avenue, in a colorful three-story hideaway in the trees located just steps away from Center Street and a block off the beach. A main-level dining room can serve large and small groups, while the patio deck and "Octopus bar,” featuring a soaring upcycled octopus by artist Jeff Kopish, provide ample seating for families, friends, and sun-kissed beachgoers. A mid-floor services private parties, while the lantern-lit top-floor bar and rooftop deck serve as overflow on busy nights and as a private event space. Street parking available.
